name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Oh how you kids whine.
In the apartment my old man grew up in the '30's in the Bronx, there was this tough Italian thug lived upstairs, Jake.
One day it's in the news Italy has invaded Ethiopia, so what does Jake do? He goes around the neighborhood beating up every black kid he finds. Italian pride.

About 25 years ago, this movie comes out by Martin Scorcese starring Robert DeNiro. It's a fight movie, my dad's always been a fan.

My sister's nagging on to my dad about going to see it.
"Who's it about?"
"Jake, um, LaMotta?"
"That bum? NO way am I gonna see a movie about him!"

Then he tells the anecdote about young Jake that Scorsese somehow didn't manage to put in the film.
The little brother, played by Joe Pesci? Him and my dad couldn't stand each other.

name: cracklewater
text: You have some kind of dog-litter box?

name: nice-on-water
text: No, we walk her and clean up after her like responsible pet owners.  HUGE slam on non-pet-walking-owners out of nowhere!

name: hatstand_mcq
text: So you don't let your dog out into the garden at all? How often do you walk her? Even if her bowels are regular as clockwork she still has to piss multiple times a day I assume, unless you purposely dehydrate her, which doesn't sound like responsible pet ownership at all. Anyway, why is it easier to clear up after your dog on a walk than in your own garden? Your story is full of holes.

name: nice-on-water
text: We don't stop her when she shits but we don't actively promote yard-shitting, and as a consequence she doesn't shit outside with the frequency of other dogs whose owners don't walk them.  She knows the leash means walky times and that's when you shit.  She has pretty regular bowels, even for being 11 years old.  And as a result of being 11, she's known that for 11 goddamn years she will get walked three times a day.  So back da fuck UP bitch, don't question my family or dog or dog-walking methods because we got this shit down.  Let your dog piss and shit in the hydrangeas; my dog has some motherfucking class.

name: nice-on-water
text: As for ease 1) you're there, you have the bag, it's easier 2) she gets walked down the street, and it's easier to pick up shit with a bag on concrete than with a pooper-scooper on grass.  This cannot be disputed.  You have a dog, you better get used to getting pretty close to shit.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: You certainly seem to have a lot of anger around this issue. You are, however, right to imply that my dog lacks class. All this autumn she was eating windfall plums, which wrought havoc on her carnivorous bowels, before picking out and chewing the plum stones out of her own loose shit. She is a pitbull cross, and generally a creature of low upbringing and crass demeanor. I like that we have devoted a small corner of assetbar to discuss dog shit. I've always thought that having a dog is a bit like having a baby, in that you suddenly find yourself intimately involved with another creatures defecatory habits.

name: nice-on-water
text: I'm the opposite of nearly every Achewood character (and seemingly Onstad) in that I love most dogs without much discrimination or reason, and my dog tops the list.  It's one of a few things I'm probably overly sentimental about.  The portrait of the mushy dog owner, that's me no doubt.  And I ain't care what the Assetbarbarian cynics think about it.

text:
One of my mom's boyfriends had a red El Camino and would secretly pay me to stay out of the house. If none of my friends were home, I would wander the woods for $2 an hour.

But my Circumstances were not nearly as damaging as Beef's. Also, I did not have Unfortunate Hair%u2122.

name: pygmalion00
text: Mike Castelli lacks the swarthiness of all the Italians I know.  He also lacks the quintessential chest hair which gently nestles his crucifix.  Yes, I am aware he is a cat and has chest hair by default, but I'm talking the kind that's long, curly and black with a few tinges of grey every now and again.

name: granularsilica
text: News flash: There are blond, blue-eyed Italians too! My best pal Ardito is one.

name: puguglypress
text: Well look at the GENIUS who has a FRIEND!

name: shelbydavis
text: Since this is from Ray's perspective, I find it odd that we are treated to a visualisation of a nicotine molecule.  That definitely seems more like a thing you'd get from the guy considering tattooing Na-Cl on his arm.

name: greenkoolayd
text: indeed.

name: gladi8orrex
text: my dad's mad at me cuz he got mad at me. what a crazy mixed up worl'... g'd.

name: genequagmire
text: Rusty.

text: Man, that is nasty! That is mega nasty dog shit, man!

name: fuckin_wizard
text: We mostly operate meth labs on the weekends I guess. Or maybe it's the dude across the street who just sits on his front lawn revving up his four-wheeler at noon everyday, presumably because he's on house arrest and cannot leave his squalid property.

name: fuckin_wizard
text: Like one of three times that I decide to leave a comment and I go and fuck up real bad.

name: lux
text: chubbied for schadenfreude

name: daidai
text: Chubbied because I thought the rope around your avatar's waist was a beaker the first time I saw it and I thought it was some kind of edu-tainment SCIENCE WIZARD and it made me laugh and think that it would be really funny if Bill Nye posted on AssetBar. Then I thought it would be funny to hear about Bill Nye in a huge scandal, like he bled out like thirty kids and left them in a greenhouse or something. Or like, he went to a club in Vegas and made it rain on a bouncer or something. All with a gold chain that says "science bought this bling" and grills made of a new alloy he invented

name: fuckin_wizard
text: Sounds more like Beakman than Nye.

name: lateadopter
text:
Hey, look, Mike Castelli's head is novel. Usually they are recycled:
[IMGS OFF]

name: srikamaraja
text: Sir this is not a case of cephalorecyclatory laziness, as those cambrian-cats are blood-related.

name: lateadopter
text: Okay, look at the GOF and the naked guys fighting in the hot tub.  Heads is recycled in the main.

name: nice-on-water
text: Note the detail in Mike's rendering: the curly hair (odd for an Italian, I would wager); the crow's feet, other detail on the eyes.  Mike's a one of a kind kinda dude.  The name, however, is pretty recycled.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
you'd lose that wager, I'd bet.


[IMGS OFF]

name: nice-on-water
text: I'd make another wager and say that it's not extremely common.

name: nice-on-water
text: Look at the jaws.  There's like two or three main heads there with some hair and eye-differences added.

name: miaou
text: "You see, in this world there's two kinds of people, my friend: those with loaded guns, and those who dig. You dig."

name: miaou
text: Dig?

name: nice-on-water
text:
Those that come in through the door
Those that come in through the window
----
Those who have a rope around their neck
Those who do the cutting
----
Those who have friends
Those who are lonely...like Tuco

like Tuco

name: jeffspaulding
text: You know it's from ROTLA, not Il Buono, il Brutto, il Cattivo .

name: nice-on-water
text: I know how fond of puns and shit you are so I'm really wary to interpret this as a real question, lest the joke goes over my head, but no guts no glory, so let me respond with: no, it's from The Good The Bad and the Ugly; Blondie says it at the end to Tuco.

name: nice-on-water
text: Oh, you're referring to the picture, and you're talking to miaou.  Apologies.

name: miaou
text: Oh, I had no idea where your picture came from; although I should have clicked at the sight of ze distinctive hat...

name: smilebuddha
text:
You ever going to get around to throwing me the Idol?
(Something from Rebel Yell or before, please)

name: spaceshib
text: shits happen

name: jvsw
text: I want a small times t-shirt, and I'd pay for it.

name: nice-on-water
text: I'd get it if it included "Knuckleheads Since."

name: nice-on-water
text: The idea of making sure "power is actual" is a damn raw philosophy to have.  Basically maintain this and you're good.  Also RAW.

name: granularsilica
text: Raw from getting whopped up the side of the head for constantly challenging actual power, that is.

name: nice-on-water
text: I don't think that's what that means.

name: greenkoolayd
text: not what it means, but thats what happens.

name: srikamaraja
text: Ray is possessed of a remarkable inability to See Why Not. It is an affliction of many such great men.

name: mattylite
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: charchar
text: Roast Beef can muster enough excitement for excalamation, but not quite enough to colour them anything more than a dull grey. Until there's dog shit involved.

name: i_love_kate
text: Similar to how his pupils respond to a reenactment of Cheers.

name: onegoodmonkey
text:
I'll probably get lamed for this, but here it is. I started my own webcomic last year, and am feeling around for ways to promote it. Since you guys are basically this large group of people with good taste in webcomics, it occurred to me to share it here. If you would like to check it out, it's:

www.classof99comics.com

name: mattylite
text: I would have lamed you but instead I thought your comic was hilarious, so I chubbied you.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: I'll pay you to not promote it.

name: puguglypress
text:
If you imagine these characters as stuffed animals it's a whole lot like very early Achewood, the influence is really apparent. It's a pretty decent strip actually, I'll probably read some more later, a step above the average crap webcomic for sure. It's gonna be tough to get people to look at it though, I mean it's called "Class of 99" and it's about a bunch of twenty-something slackers who hang out, it's on the internet and it uses Achewood-style humor. I have a tough time seeing that standing out very much. (Thank you for not making it about gamers, though.)

Having done webcomics myself, my advice to you is don't expect a whole lot out of it. You'll gain an appreciation of other comics that you read, and you'll enjoy the rush that comes with putting a joke together, but that's about it.

name: puguglypress
text: In any case, chubbied so this will hopefully turn green and give you a few hits before this gets lamed out of existence.

name: onegoodmonkey
text:
I sincerely appreciate all that blunt feedback, and the assessment that it's "pretty decent." Except.... I'm not sure how you arrived at my characters being slackers. I mean, really? "Slackers?" Is that term even relevant anymore?

I get the idea that maybe your own experience creating a webcomic let you down. Your advice is very cynical. I'm not doing this comic this to make money, rest assured... but I've already found it to be a thoroughly rewarding endeavor, for many reasons - just one of which is knowing I've made some person in, like, Wisconsin laugh about some ridiculous thing I drew.

name: granularsilica
text:
Hey, I'm in Wisconsin, which does look like a face (for those who don't go there, he did a strip about states that look like faces in profile).

Great comic, really fresh approach to life. Really like Mo Stoned. Keep 'em comin'.

name: puguglypress
text: I am a bit of a sucker for those mice. "I feel like I could fuckin do ANYTHING" lol

name: onegoodmonkey
text: Wow, thanks you guys!

name: missbee
text: It seems pretty decent so far.

name: charchar
text: I giggled, and I seldom giggle.  Adding this to Google Reader.

name: fresco
text: Ray knows there ain't nothin worse than a stink Stussy.

name: jeffspaulding
text: Your stinkstuss puts a hurt on my nose.

name: awksedperl
text: Can you rinse it off, do you suppose?

name: puguglypress
text:
Wow, that last panel is so beautiful. What an interesting way to draw flow-

Oh.
EEEEEEWWWWW

name: doppelganger
text:
Wait just a fuckin' second -- Are you tellin' me that CATS have pet DOGS !?

That's bullshit -- I think Onstad forgot his premise.

name: hatstand_mcq
text: It's like in a film where everyone speaks English although they are in medieval France or somewhere. The Achewood cats actually keep pet voles, but Onstad calls them dogs because that would be the human equivalent. It's like when they talk about burritos, but they're actually eating little bits of sparrow mixed with leaf mould.

name: shelbydavis
text: You're thinking of Redwall, actually.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: eh, wot

name: shelbydavis
text: Flippin' bally wot.

name: aedved2
text: I lived next to a dude like Castelli back in the day. 'cept that instead of a large backyard, his dog would defecate in the small patio of his townhouse. It was horrible in the summer -- I don't know that words can describe it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: hell of dog turds roasting in the sun, all causing malodorous clouds of dog-ass smell.

name: granularsilica
text: A concrete serving platter of raw dogshit, suitably aged and stanky.

text:
remids me of joke:

wat is diff 'tween balk mang n dog shit? lol dog shit eventally turns white n stops stinkin'. lol

text: and it came from a DOG!! lolol

text: haha NICE

name: puguglypress
text: I've noticed that now that I can't rate the strips, I don't think of them in terms of "3, 4, 5" anymore and don't try to classify them as much in terms of "is this better/worse than the previous strip". I wonder if this feature was deactivated on purpose so we'd get more into the story instead of constantly quantifying every little section of it
